content.description: Pluralistic is Cory Doctorow's daily blog. One blog that I read almost as soon as it hits my RSS feed.
Maggie is a designer, anthropologist and developer. She writes about just about anything.
Wouter is a baker, programmer, writer and teacher. He blogs about a lot of different things.
Works in Progress release a quaterly magazine, which in their own words, features 'new and underrated ideas to improve the world'
A fascinating article about the history of Britain's housing policy.
An article that managed to sum up a lot of my disjointed thoughts on modern capitalism and big tech.

content.link: [Why we didn't get a malaria vaccine sooner | Works in Progress](https://worksinprogress.co/issue/why-we-didnt-get-a-malaria-vaccine-sooner/)
content.description: A long read detailing the economics of vaccine production and what alternative funding options exist.

content.link: [How the Blog Broke the Web | Stacking the Bricks](https://stackingthebricks.com/how-blogs-broke-the-web/)
content.description: Amy Hoy breaks down the modern idea of blogs and details what we lost by following this route.
